alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued November 28 at 9:25PM HST until November 28 at 11:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... At 925 PM HST, radar indicated heavy rain has decreased over East Maui and the slow moving thunderstorms have moved just off shore. The heaviest rain over the past 60 minutes was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. Stream levels will remain elevated over the next few hours. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Nahiku, Kipahulu, Keanae, Hana, Kaupo, Huelo, Haiku-Pauwela, Wailua, Haleakala National Park, Kailua and Hamoa. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. The heavy rains may cause rock and mudslides in steep terrain areas. Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
